## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 637]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 666, 212, 679]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 518, 918, 555]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the curve with equation \(y = \frac{1}{\sqrt{x}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{x}}\) for \(x \geqslant 1\), together with a set of \(n - 1\) rectangles of unit width.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 568, 680, 585]]<|/det|>
<pre>(a) By considering the sum of the areas of these rectangles, show that  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 600, 417, 644]]<|/det|>
\[
\sum_{r=1}^{n} \frac{1}{\sqrt{r}} \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{r}}<\left(2+\frac{1}{\sqrt{n}}\right) \mathrm{e}^{\sqrt{n}}-2 \mathrm{e} .
\]

\]

It is given that 

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[283, 102, 716, 120]]<|/det|>
\[x = \tanh^{-1} t \quad \text { and } \quad y = t \operatorname{sech}^{-1} t, \quad \text { for } 0<t<1.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 147, 136, 163]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 144, 504, 168]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}=-\sqrt{1-t^{2}}+\left(1-t^{2}\right) \operatorname{sech}^{-1} t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 147, 916, 163]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[120, 460, 136, 476]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 450, 337, 486]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 460, 916, 476]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 72, 101, 88]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 72, 465, 88]]<|/det|>
Find the solution of the differential equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 110, 600, 144]]<|/det|>
\[
\frac{\mathrm{d} y}{\mathrm{~d} x}-\frac{x+5}{x^{2}+10 x+61} y=1,
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 165, 630, 181]]<|/det|>
given that \(y=0\) when \(x=3\). Give your answer in an exact form.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 136, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
It is given that \(\lambda\) is an eigenvalue of the non-singular square matrix \(\mathbf{A}\), with corresponding eigenvector \(\mathbf{e}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 120, 715, 137]]<|/det|>
Show that \(\mathbf{e}\) is an eigenvector of \(\mathbf{A}^{3}\) with corresponding eigenvalue \(\lambda^{3}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 120, 920, 137]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[121, 401, 316, 417]]<|/det|>
<pre>The matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) is given by

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[427, 423, 576, 481]]<|/det|>
\[
\mathbf{A}=\left(\begin{array}{rrr}
-1 & 3 & 4 \\
0 & 1 & 0 \\
0 & -2 & 5
\end{array}\right) .
\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 508, 136, 524]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 508, 532, 524]]<|/det|>
Show that the eigenvalues of \(\mathbf{A}\) are \(-1,1\) and 5.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[885, 508, 920, 524]]<|/det|>
